nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.title: A Tense Afternoon
nodes.text: You walk into the living room and hear raised voices. Your child sits small on the couch. The co-parent and step-parent are arguing about discipline.

choices.label: Step between them calmly.
choices.text: You raise your hands gently: “Okay, let’s pause. What’s going on?”

choices.label: Take the co-parent's side immediately.
choices.text: You cut in: “Hey, if we agreed on rules, they need to be followed.”

choices.label: Take the step-parent’s side immediately.
choices.text: You step in: “They’re trying their best. Don’t attack them like this.”

nodes.speaker: Co-Parent
nodes.title: Whose Rules?
nodes.text: The co-parent turns: “They keep changing the rules! One day bedtime is flexible, the next it’s strict. How is our child supposed to feel safe?”

choices.label: Acknowledge the inconsistency.
choices.text: “Fair point. Consistency matters. Let’s figure out where the rules misalign.”

choices.label: Shift blame to the co-parent.
choices.text: “Maybe if you communicated more clearly, things wouldn’t be confusing.”

choices.label: Focus on the child instead of blame.
choices.text: “Let’s pause blaming and look at how this argument feels for our child.”

nodes.speaker: Step-Parent
nodes.title: Feeling Left Out
nodes.text: The step-parent sighs: “I feel like I’m expected to help, but the moment I set a limit, I’m overstepping. I don’t know what role I’m allowed to have.”

choices.label: Clarify their role kindly.
choices.text: “You’re part of this home. Let’s define together what boundaries feel respectful for everyone.”

choices.label: Minimize their feelings.
choices.text: “This isn’t about you. We’re talking about the child.”

choices.label: Ask each adult to share one boundary they need.
choices.text: “Why don’t we try this—each of us names one boundary that would help us feel grounded?”

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.title: Pause or Progress
nodes.text: The tension softens. It’s not perfect and not final, but the conversation shifts from conflict to clarity. The child looks relieved.
